metadata.Title: CVE-2021-45469 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In __f2fs_setxattr in fs/f2fs/xattr.c in the Linux kernel through 5.15.11, there is an out-of-bounds memory access when an inode has an invalid last xattr entry. Wenqing Liu discovered that the f2fs file system in the Linux kernel did not properly validate the last xattr entry in an inode. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious f2fs image that, when mounted and operated on, could cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45469` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1102-aws - 4.4.0-1102.107
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1131-azure - 4.15.0-1131.144~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-lowlatency - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1131-azure - 4.15.0-1131.144~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-lowlatency - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1102.107').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1131.144~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1131.144~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1').
